DESC.PARA: The set_staterror command sets the statistical errors for a dataset. The error value may be an array or a single value to be repeated for every bin. Setting the fractional argument uses the scalar value as the fractional portion of the dependent array as the errors.

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the dataset to use; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")
val - array or scalar error values
fractional - use a fractional portion of the dependent array as the error? default=False . May be set to True , only if the "val" is a scalar.
bkg_id - the id of the background, if setting the background value; default=None

DESC.PARA: Sherpa reads in the grouping flags from file and turns on grouping by default, if possible. The errors will be grouped if grouping is on.
Set the staterrors to an array of error values.
Set the statistical errors for dataset id=2 to 0.04 for all bins.
Use a fractional portion (0.05) of the dependent array as the errors for the default dataset.
